data.name: SSP_LabelHostServerType.ToolTip
data.value: Server Type - A 'ClientServer' is a server type where the host plays while they are hosting the server in the same game instance. When hosting a 'Dedicated' server, the host is not a player in the game and instead monitors the game from a console window. You will need to use another game instance to join this server locally to play.

data.name: SSP_LabelJoinServerPreventAddonDownload.ToolTip
data.value: Prevent Add-on Download - Prevents the client from downloading any add-on files from the server. Will most likely prevent the game from connecting to modded servers if there are add-on mismatches or missing.

data.name: SSP_LabelOnlineMode.ToolTip
data.value: Online Mode - With 'JoinServer' selected, the game will automatically try to join the specified server upon launch. With 'HostServer' selected, the game will automatically to try to create a multiplayer lobby. Use 'Offline' to start the game as normal - can still connect to other servers through the in-game menus.

data.name: SSP_LabelJoinServerIP.ToolTip
data.value: Server IP - If an external IP address is specified, SRB2 will automatically try to connect to a netgame with that IP address. If no IP address is specified, SRB2 will search for a server on the local network and connect to the first server found if there are any.

data.name: SSP_LabelJoinServerPort.ToolTip
data.value: Server Port - Leave empty if joining an external server. Specifies the local UDP port to use. If you are hosting a netgame, this is useful for joining your own netgame with another instance of SRB2 on the same computer, especially if you are hosting a dedicated server.

data.name: SSP_LabelHostServerGameType.ToolTip
data.value: Server Game Type - Sets the game type when hosting a server. This parameter is in the same format as that accepted by the map command's own -gametype parameter. Leave empty if this is not needed or have no knowledge about.

data.name: SSP_LabelHostServerBroadcasting.ToolTip
data.value: Server Public Broadcasting - If enabled, the server will be advertised on the public Master Server List. 'Standard' Room; Servers playing the official game types included with SRB2(K) should be hosted with this room type. Or 'Casual' Room; Servers playing the game in a different way than originally intended, such as role-playing or hangout, should be hosted in this room.
